abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Public
            Resource Management Credit Project is to improve economic
            management capacity, strengthen and deepen recent fiscal
            gains, improve the efficiency of the allocation and
            management of public expenditure and increase domestic
            savings.  The project consists of the following two
            components: 1) a policy reform program, which aims at: (a)
            improving domestic resource mobilization by broadening and
            diversifying the tax base;  and (b) improving public
            expenditure allocation and management by preparing a
            three-year rolling public expenditure program that is
            consistent with the macroeconomic framework and oriented
            toward poverty reduction; and 2) a capacity building
            program, which will focus on: (a) improving the
            organizational structures and administrative procedures of
            five key ministries (Planning including the Office Nationale
            Statistique, Finance, Fisheries, Commerce and Industry); and
            (b) improving economic policy-making capacity by
            strengthening the Technical Secretariat of the
            Interministerial Committee for Economic Policy.
